author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Joint Action Council of College Teachers (JAC) of Tamil Nadu continued its picketing of the Joint Director of Collegiate Education’s office here on Thursday, as part of their two-day protest in five cities in the State, in support of various demands, including filling up of vacancies.

The JAC, a coalition of four associations of teachers from colleges, universities and non-teaching staff from aided colleges, demanded that the 3,120 teaching vacancies in colleges in the State as on May 2011 be filled immediately in a transparent manner as per the recommendations of the committee constituted to study the workload of teaching staff. It also urged the government to fill the Vice-Chancellor’s posts that lying vacant for several months in many universities in Tamil Nadu. The JAC termed the new Contributory Pension Scheme an evil system and demanded restoration of the old Definite Benefit Scheme.

The other demands included payment of salary as per the norms of University Grants Commission for teaching staff in university constituent colleges and self-financed courses. The teachers also demanded that staff associations be consulted while deciding on higher education policies. The protesters said that they had written to the Chief Minister earlier this month highlighting their demands.

Around 300 teaching staff from the associations participated in the protest on Wednesday and Thursday. Apart from Madurai, the protest was also held in Chennai, Coimbatore, Tiruchi and Tirunelveli.
title: Picketing by college teachers continues
